event.title: the early 1980s, the Cherokee Nation, under the direction of Wilma Mankiller (then the director of the Cherokee Nation Community Development Department, later principal chief) and her colleague (and future husband) Charlie Soap, put

data.event: In the early 1980s, the Cherokee Nation, under the direction of Wilma Mankiller (then the director of the Cherokee Nation Community Development Department, later principal chief) and her colleague (and future husband) Charlie Soap, put together a project to build a 16-mile waterline to Bell, where many of the residents still had no indoor plumbing.

event.title: The project is the subject of a 2013

data.event: The project is the subject of a 2013 feature film, The Cherokee Word for Water.

event.title: June 2010, after systemic auditing by the Oklahoma state Board of Education, the 200-year-old school district was demanded

data.event: In June 2010, after systemic auditing by the Oklahoma state Board of Education, the 200-year-old school district was demanded to be closed by the state.
